direction.raw_text: Now that the war's over, our soldiers get to come home, yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of them. Some will be stationed on the rim planets as Peace Enforcers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand. Why were the Independents even fighting us? Why wouldn't they look to be more civilized?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a good question. Does anybody want to open on that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear they're cannibals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's only Reavers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reavers aren't real.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Full well they are. They attack settlers from space, they kill them and wear their skins and rape them for hours and hours -- TEACHER (in Chinese) (CALMER) It's true that there are... dangers on the outer planets. So let's follow up on Borodin's question. With all the social and medical advancements we can bring to the Independents, why would they fight so hard against us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We meddle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: River? RIVER is a dark, intense little girl, writing with one hand and "typing" with the other. (Typing consists of holding a long wooden stylus and tapping either end down different columns of chinese characters on her desktop screen.) She is a good two years younger than the other kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People don't like to be meddled with. We tell them what to do, what to think, don't run don't walk we're in their homes and in their heads and we haven't the right. We're meddlesome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gently taking her
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) River, we're not telling people what to think. We're just trying to show them how. She violently PLUNGES the stylus into the girl's forehead
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we FLASH CUT to the actual present: a 16 year old RIVER sitting in a metal chair, needles stuck in her skull (one right where the teacher had stuck her) being adjusted by a technician. A second monitors her brain patterns. The lab is cold, blue, steel. Insidiously clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's dreaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nightmare?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off the charts. Scary monsters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's amp it up. Delcium, eight- drop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is not instantly likable -- nor gradually, for that matter. A cold man, and more than a little satisfied with himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Behind him stands a GOVERNMENT INSPECTOR, observing. And making him a little nervous. The Inspector is in shadow, but his uniform indicates
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: no substantial rank, as does the eagle-crested baton longer than a ruler -- that he clutches in one gloved hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, most of our best work is done when they're asleep. We can monitor and direct their subconscious, implant suggestions... River starts convulsing, mewing in misery. The Inspector starts forward, slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a little startling to see, but the results are spectacular. Especially in this case. River Tam is our star pupil. The Inspector steps into the light. He is rigid, cold, staring at the girl with no emotion at all. His name, as we will very soon learn, is SIMON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've heard that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a genius. Her mental capacity is extraordinary, even with the side-effects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me about them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, obviously, she's unstable... the neural stripping gives them heightened cognitive reception, but it also destabilizes their own reality matrix. It manifests as borderline schizophrenia... which at this point is the price for being truly psychic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (moves toward her) What use do we have for a psychic if she's insane?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have to tell you the security potential of someone who can read minds. And she has lucid periods -- we hope to improve upon the... I'm sorry, Sir, I have to ask if there's some reason for this inspection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I making you nervous?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Key members of Parliament have personally observed this subject. I was told their support for the project was unanimous. The demonstration of her power -- SIMON (turns back to her) How is she physically?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like nothing we've seen. All our subjects are conditioned for combat, but River... she's a creature of extraordinary grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. She always did love to dance. He drops to one knee, slamming his baton to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE BATON As the top pops off like a bouncing betty (the grenade), flying up over Simon and River's heads and then bursting forth in a flat circle of blue energy that bisects the room, flowing through the staff's heads and knocking them out. Simon rushes to River, gently removes the probes from her head and swabs her, whispering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: River. Wake up. Please, it's Simon. River. It's your brother. Wake up... She begins to stir as a noise moves him to the door, looking out and removing his uniform to reveal an orderly's tunic beneath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . River is suddenly next to him. He jumps a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simon. A beat, as they face each other, Simon fighting emotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They know you've come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a guard looks at a monitor. He mostly resembles a secret service man -- more bureaucrat than thug. A second man rolls into frame on a chair behind him, also watching the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simon walks River through the corridor. They approach a pair of double doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't make it to the surface from inside. Simon turns suddenly as he hears footsteps, people heading at them from the other side of the doors. 4wo SIMON (CONTINUING) Find a -- But River has, impossibly, scampered up over some lab equipment to the dark top of the corridor, where she holds herself in a perfect split, feet against the walls and outstretched hand holding the sprinkler for support. The doors burst open and two doctors pass by, hardly noticing the lone orderly. Passing right under River.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's small, 15 feet by 15 feet. Goes a long way up and a long way down. One wide hinged window looks in on the hall inside. Simon and River approach with quiet haste. They slip through the window. Simon shuts it, wedges his baton into the handle as the SECURITY AGENTS APPROACH. They fire at the glass, but their lasers have no effect. Wind whips River's hair about as she looks up to see a small patch of daylight visible ten stories up. Sees the sky blotted out by a small ship that hovers above them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE SHIP is floating over the grass of rolling hills, the city gleaming far beyond. This facility is well hidden. A gurney-sized section of the ship's belly detaches and drops down ten stories, cables spooling it out of the ship. It comes to Simon and River and stops suddenly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get on! He is standing by the window -- and the Security Agent is right behind him, PUNCHING the window with all his might. Simon helps River onto the gurney, then jumps on himself as the Security Agent cracks the glass. The two are whisked up in the gurney, River on her knees, Simon standing beside her holding one of the cables -- THE OPERATIVE (O.S.) Stop. The action freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (0.S.) (CONTINUING) Lovely. Lovely. Backtrack. The action REVERSES, taking us back to the moment of Simon and River on the gurney just before it rises. f t o
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONTINUING) Stop. There is a motionless beat, River frozen in that crouch, and he steps through what we now see is a hologram of the event. The Government's man. We'll just call him THE OPERATIVE. He is thoughtful, a little removed. Wire-rimmed glasses, a suit too nondescript to be a uniform, too neat to be casual wear. He is in:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which is long and bare but for drawers of holographic records, a set-up for watching recordings (where the image of Simon and River floats), and a table with computer and chair. The Operative crosses to the table, looks over some papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biograph. Simon Tam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: THE OPERATIVE'S GLASSES IWO 8. As Simon's history files down in print and pictures -- graduation, security photo from his medical internship -- over one lens of the Operative's glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remarkable children. Doctor Mathias storms in, two security men (not the ones from the opening) and a nervous young female intern following. Mathias looks greyer and more gaunt than when we saw him last.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me! No one is allowed in the records room without my express permission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (over this, quietly) Enter the doctor. (to Mathias) Forgive me. I prefer to see the event alone, without bias. Mathias looks at the hologram -- realizes which one it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to see your clearance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right to insist. I know you've had security issues here. He places his hand on a screen as he says it. Mathias looks at the readout, and drops the bluster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apologies. An Operative of the Parliament will of course have full cooperation. (looks at screen) I'm not sure what... I see no listing of rank, or name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have neither. Like this facility, I don't exist. The Parliament calls me in when... when they wish they didn't have to. Let's talk about the Tams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I assume you've scanned the status logs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: River was your greatest success. A prodigy -- A phenomenon. Until her brother walked in eight months ago and took her from you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not quite so simple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm very aware of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He came in with full creds. He beat the ap-scan, the retinal... There was no way I could -- THE OPERATIVE No, no. Of course. The boy spent his fortune developing the contacts to infiltrate this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gave up a brilliant future in. medicine as well, you've probably read. Turned his back on his whole life. Madness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madness, no. Something a good deal more dangerous. Have you looked at this scan carefully? At his face? Mathias looks uncertain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's love, in point of fact. He loved his sister and he knew she was in pain. So he took her somewhere safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here because the situation is even less simple than you think. (eyeing him) Do you know what your sin is, Doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I would be very careful about what you -- THE OPERATIVE (SADLY) It's pride. He touches the computer screen and the hologramic image jumps to the Doctor and Simon in the lab, Mathias repeating:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Key members of Parliament have personally observed this subject. I was told their support -- THE OPERATIVE (shutting it off) Key members of Parliament. Key. The minds behind every diplomatic, military and covert operation in the galaxy, and you put them in a room with a psychic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was... she read cards, nothing more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's come to our attention that River became much more unstable, more... disturbed, after you showed her off to Parliament. Did she see something very terrible in those cards?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever... secrets she might have accidentally gleaned... it's probable she doesn't even know she knows them. That they're buried beneath -- THE OPERATIVE But they are in her. Her mind is unquiet. It's the will of the Parliament that I kill her. And the brother. Because of your sin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing; moving to his briefcase) You know, in certain older civilized cultures, when men failed as entirely as you have, they would throw themselves on their swords.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (fed up) Well, unfortunately I forgot to bring a sword to -- The air rings crisply as the Operative pulls out his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Parliament has no further interest in psychics. They represent a threat to the harmony and stability of our Alliance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would put that down right now if I were you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you be killed in your sleep, like an ailing pet? Whatever your failings, I believe you deserve better than that. The agents move. He slices the throat of the one behind him with true grace, thrusting at the second as he's pulling out his gun and pinning his hand. A moment, and the dying agent reflexively squeezes the trigger, shooting his own arm. The Operative pulls out the sword and the agent falls as quietly as the first. Mathias bolts but the Operative pins him to the wall. He bunches his fingers and jabs the side of the Doctor's spine. Mathias stiffens, suddenly, agonizingly immobile. The Operative steps back, observes the Doctor's rigid grimace for a moment. Almost ceremoniously, he drops to one knee and holds the blade out to one side, hilt to the floor and point tilted toward the doctor. The Doctor stares at it in horror as his paralyzed body begins to tip over toward it. The Operative turns toward the terrified intern at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Young miss, I'll need all the logs- on behavioral modification triggers. We'll have to reach out to River Tam, and help her to come back to us. No matter how far out Simon has taken her, we can -- He's almost startled when the Doctor's body drops into frame, slowed suddenly by the sword. It squeaks down the blade, the Doctor unable to cry out, as the Operative whispers to him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a good death. There's no shame in this, in a man's death. A man who's done fine works. We're making a better world. All of them, better worlds. Mathias is dead. The Operative pulls the sword out as the body rolls over. As he wipes the sword down:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Young miss, I need you to get to work now. I think I may have a long way to travel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes. He approaches River, very close, staring...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you hiding,,little girl? The noise is sucked suddenly out of the room as we black out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . becomes the name painted on the side of a spaceship, with the same in Chinese behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We move away from the ship. The name is on the nose, under the bridge. It sticks out from the body of the ship like a craning neck. The body is bulbous, with propulsion engines on either side and a giant glowing back. There are two small shuttles tucked in over the 'wings' of the engines. It's not the sleekest ship in the 'verse, to be sure. As it hits atmo, the propulsion engines take over and she starts to rock a bit, noise filling our ears. Camera comes around the front, at the windows and into the bridge, to see the Captain, MALCOLM 'MAL' REYNOLDS, standing and watching. At that moment, a small piece of the nose breaks off and goes flying past the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [Note: the following sequence will take us through the ship in one extended STEADICAM shot.] The bridge is small: two pilot seats on either side, and a tangle of wires and machinery all about. Mal wears the knee-length brown coat and boots of an old Independent. Gun at his hip. He's not unlike the ship -- he's seen a bit of the world and it left him, emotionally at least, weathered. Right now, though, he's mostly startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that? He's addressing the pilot, WASH. Flight gear and a hawaiian shirt, toy dinosaurs populating his station -- no old soldier, but just as startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoah! Did you see that -- The ship bucks -- MAL Was that the primary buffer panel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It did seem to resemble -- J 14.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did the Primary Buffer Panel just fall off my gorramn ship for no apparent reason? Another buck -- WASH Looks like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought Kaylee checked our entry couplings! I have a very clear memory of it -- WASH Yeah well if she doesn't give us some extra flow from the engine room to offset the burnthrough this landing is gonna get pretty interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Define "Interesting".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calm suggestion:) "Oh god, oh god, we're all gonna die?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hits the com) This is the Captain. There's a little problem with our entry sequence; we may experience slight turbulence and then explode. (to Wash, exiting) Can you shave the vector -- WASH I'm doing it! It's not enough. (hits com) Kaylee!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just get us on the ground!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That part'll happen, pretty definitely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The camera leads Mal down. On either side of the hall are ladders leading down to crew's personal quarters. The hulking mercenary JAYNE is coming up out of his bunk as Mal passes. He carries a number of rifles and grenades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: we're gonna explode? I don't wanna explode.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jayne, how many weapons you plan on bringing? You only got the two arms...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just get excitable as to choice, like to have my options open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't plan on any shooting taking place during this job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what you plan and what takes place ain't ever exactly been similar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No grenades. (Jayne groans) No grenades. First Mate ZOE enters from the lower level. Her mode of dress and military deference mark her as a war buddy of Mal's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we crashing again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talk to your husband. Is the mule prepped?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good to go, sir. Just loading her up. (to Jayne) Are those grenades?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cap'n doesn't want 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're robbing the place. We're not occupying it. All that plays in the background as we lead Mal into the:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the communal space of the ship, homey and messy. There is food left lying on the table. Mal swipes a dumpling from a plate, pops it in his mouth as another jolt rocks him and sends most of the tableware clattering to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling out) Kaylee! He enters:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still calling) Kaylee, what in the sphincter of hell are you playing at? The hall leads to the rust-brown chaos that is the engine room. Working around the engine in a forest of wires, sparks and smoke is the sweetly pretty mechanic, KAYLEE. She passes Mal with a slightly impatient smile as he stands in the doorway, raising his voice above the din.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got the Primary Buffer
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's shiny, Cap'n. Not to fret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told me -- (JOLT) You told me the entry couplings would hold for another week!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was six months ago, cap'n.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My ship don't crash. If she crashes, you crashed her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steam and electricity shoot at him, backing him up. He turns to see Simon behind him. Simon is more seasoned than before, but still contrasts the Captain entirely in dress and manner. He is implacably proper. Also pissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor. Guess I need to get innocked 'fore we hit planetside. Simon nods, the ship jolting again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bit of a rockety ride. Nothing to worry about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fear is nothing to be ashamed of, Doc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't fear. This is anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's kinda hard to tell the one from t'other, face like yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I imagine if it were fear, my eyes would be wider.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll look for that next time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not taking her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (brushing past him) No no, that's not a thing I'm interested in talking over with -- SIMON She's not going with you. That's final.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning back) I hear the words "that's final" come out of your mouth ever again, they truly will be. (turning away again) This is my boat. Y'all are guests on it. He heads down a side corridor that has steps leading down to:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simon is right on his heels as we lead them down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guests? I earn my passage, Captain -- MAL And it's time your little sister learned from your fine example.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've earned my passage treating bullet holes, knife wounds, laser burns...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of our jobs are trickier than others -- SIMON And you want to put my sister in the middle of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't say 'want'. Said 'will'. It's one job, Doc. She'll be fine. The passenger dorm has a time-worn warmth that most of the ship shares. Except, of course, for the sterile blue of:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Into which the two men step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a seventeen year old girl. A mentally traumatized sevente--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a reader. Sees into the truth of things; might see trouble before it's coming. Which is of use to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's your guiding star, isn't it? What's of use.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honestly, doctor, I think we may really crash this time anyway. Simon jabs the inoculation needle into Mal's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you understand what I've gone through to keep River away from the Alliance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do, and it's a fact me and mine have been courteous enough to keep to our own selves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you threatening to -- MAL I got one purpose here: keep this boat in the air. I take the jobs I get -- which is less and less, case you ain't been keeping track. He starts away, Simon still keeping pace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every year since the war the Alliance pushes just a little further out towards the rim. Makes it a chore for naughty men like us to slip about -- and keeping you two on board means working twice as hard to avoid the law. Means turning down a score of honest jobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They enter the biggest space on the ship. Giant doors sit at the front, which will open upon landing to reveal a lowering ramp. Catwalks surround the space, leading up at the front to the foredeck hall. We've come all the way through Serenity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So here is us, on the raggedy edge. Don't push me and I won't push you. Simon starts up the stairs as Mal calls to him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things get gritty I will keep her from the fray, but she's coming. Best you get her ready. As Mal walks on, we tilt up to see the Mule, a four-man hovercraft hanging from chains near the ceiling. Jayne and Zoe are tossing duffle bags into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoe, is Wash gonna straighten this boat out before we get flattened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a downy feather, sir. Nobody flies like my mister. The camera picks up Simon's feet as they enter foreground on the catwalk, and track with them to find:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: River... She's lying on her side, looking straight at us. A loose summer dress draped over her small frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. We're going for a ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Serenity settles gently down as the cargo bay door opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The chains are hoisted back up into the ceiling of the ship. The mule floats just above the floor, Jayne piling in next to River in the back:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, River, you stay behind the others. If there's fighting you drop to the floor or run away. It's okay to leave them to die. River puts on a huge pair of goggles, looks at her brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the brains of the operation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should hit town right during Sunday worship. Won't be any crowds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If Fanty and Mingo are right about the payroll, this could look to be a sunny day for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, I'll ask you one last time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor, I'm taking your sister under my protection here. If anything happens to her, anything at all, I swear to you I will get very choked up. Honestly. There could be tears. He peels out, leaves Simon fuming. Kaylee sidles up to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't mind the Captain none, Simon. I know he'll look out for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's amazing. I bring River all the way out to the raggedy edge of the 'verse so she can hide from the Alliance by robbing banks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just a little Trading Station. They'll be back 'fore you can spit. (as he stalks off) Not that you spit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Kaylee watches him go, a tad forlorn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see the town sprawled before us, as the mule heads in. The town embodies the lives of folk out here: adobe and wood mix with metal and plastic -- whatever's on hand to build with. Right now the streets are mainly empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mule pulls up, Zoe hitching it as they speak:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we hoping to find here that equals the worth of a turd?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alliance payroll. There's peace enforcing squads stationed all about this quadrant. Can't use credits out here -- they got to pay their boys in cashy money. Which once a month rests here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something about stealing from the Alliance just warms a body like whiskey in winter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cocks his gun) Shiny. Let's be badguys. Mal turns back to River.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ready to go to work, darlin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no pattern to the pebbles here, they're completely random. I tried to count them but you drove too fast. Hummingbird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (never mind) Right. Great. Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are in a camera's eye view, right above the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The door slams open, Mal and Jayne stride in, Zoe following and whipping her hogleg right at camera without looking. Reverse to see the camera is also a small screen with "Welcome to Lilac" on it for the millisecond before it's blown to bits. There's maybe fifteen people in the place: store workers, farm-folk and a couple dirt-poor kids. It's a combination post-office, general store, bank, and most other things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hands and knees and heads bowed down! Everybody, now! Two men who appear to be farm folk rush Mal and the others. Mal draws on the elder one and he stops dead in his tracks. Mal's gun is long, not unlike Civil War era issue, but very much new in design. The other tries to tackle Jayne, which is not necessarily a great idea. Jayne clotheslines him so hard he spins right upside-down -- and Jayne grabs him by the legs and CRACK! -- bounces his head right off the floor, knocking him out cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At last. We can retire and give up this life of crime. Mal reaches in, pulls a lever and the floor opens, a six foot hole appearing, stairs leading to a corridor, all gleaming metal and blue light. Zoe smiles. Jayne peers down as Mal addresses the Trade Agent.

direction.raw_text: Is there a fed down there? Be truthful.

direction.raw_text: (O . S . ) (CONTINUING) Okay... Mal looks at Zoe and they head down into:

direction.raw_text: Which is as modern as something off the Central Planets. A short corridor leads to a real vault door, that the guard is already opening. Behind that door, a few bags of the real deal: neatly stacked cash, waiting to be robbed.

direction.raw_text: carrying a bucket and her nine year old SON are looking at the trading station a few buildings away.

As they move from him, four Reavers jump out of the shadows and grab the young man. Mal unhesitatingly draws his gun. He nudges a lever with his thumb and a cartridge pops back. Mal fires twice. The young man takes both bullets in the chest, slumps down dead.

direction.raw_text: : THE SKIFF As it heads for the mule -- ANGLE: THE MULE As it heads for the skiff -- and Serenity swoops down out of the sky, bay doors open, and comes right up behind it -- The Mule swallowed by the bigger ship -- INT. CARGO BAY - CONTINUING And only its forward momentum keeps it from being squashed as it flies backwards into the bay, narrowly missing Simon and smashing back into the staircase, sparks and people flying -- EXT. DESERT - CONTINUING Serenity tries to get altitude -- but slams right into the oncoming skiff, tearing it apart -- INT. CARGO BAY - CONTINUING A flaming portion of the top flies in, skids to the floor as small fires erupt from the mule as well -- Simon pulls a lever and jets of C02 shoot out of the floor. Simon hits the button to start the outer ramp closing, then runs to the mule. The C02 stops and he finds River sitting in her seat, completely unharmed. Cuttin' on his own face, rapin' and murdering -- I mean, I'll kill a man in a fair fight... or if I think he's gonna start a fair fight, or if he bothers me, or if there's a woman, or I'm gettin' paid -- mostly only when I'm gettin' paid. But these Reavers... last ten years they just show up like the boageyman from stories. Eating people alive? Where does that get fun? He dumps the body in, she starts the doors closing.

direction.raw_text: And here she is, moving back and down into frame, her eyes half closed in passion. She settles on a cluster of brocaded pillows, and we see another head lowering in for a kiss... Come around to see it's another lovely young woman -- and that there is a group of ten others watching intently, all in saris, on their knees. Two handsome young men with shaved heads in the back, also on their knees. Inara stops before the kiss, smiling and coming back up. She speaks to the girls (We hear only soft music) as she repositions the one she's with, lowering again; showing her the motion of surrender as if it were a dance step.

direction.raw_text: . COMPANION TRAINING HOUSE - DUSK Inara looks out at the mountains. The space she's in resembles a Tibetan monastery, if slightly more opulent. Widen to see she is with SHEYDRA, a somewhat older Companion, the woman whose voice we heard. She hands Inara a drink.

direction.raw_text: The girls. They've learned more from you these last months than the rest of us could show them in two years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're very sweet. But they're not Companions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've no hope for them? Junk the lot, start anew?

direction.raw_text: On Sihnon we started training at twelve. Years of discipline and preparation before the physical act of pleasure was even mentioned. Most of these girls -- SHEYDRA They're all of good family, the highest academic standards -- INARA Control. Was the first lesson. And the last and these worlds are not like the Central Planets. There is barbarism dressed up in the most civil weeds. Men of the highest rank who don't know the difference between a Companion and a common whore. It's unsafe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the more reason the girls look to you. You came out here alone, before the Alliance ever thought to establish a House this remote. You've seen so much. You're a figure of great romance to them. 4d INARA Great romance has nothing to do with being a Companion, Sheydra. You should know better.

Charred corpses on the nose, Cannon atop with a space-suited corpse draped within, long scars, welded-on parts and war paint... the trail of green light burns out with sporadic bursts of vapor. direction.raw_text: Then shut 'em and hide til -- ZOE We need to draw them til it's done. This is the place. We'll buy you the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the others) Move those crates back there for cover -- and make sure they ain't filled with anything goes boom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, Wash -- where's Wash? Nobody (but River) realized he wasn't there. Zoe is dead calm. ,No ZOE He ain't comin'. Everybody takes that in, Kaylee's eyes welling up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move the gorram crates! Come on! We hear savage SCREAMS from the hanger -- they're approaching. Mal moves to the door, Jayne beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : HIS POV Reavers rush toward them. He turns to Jayne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me you brought 'em this time... Jayne smiles grimly, tosses Mal a grenade as he pops his own and fastballs it at the Reavers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It explodes in their midst, smoke and man-parts flying about. Mal rolls his a shorter distance, then slams the door shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE GRENADE 40 Explodes, raining a bunch of equipment -- and part of a catwalk -- right in front of the door. In the black room, the door nearly buckles from the explosion. Everyone takes positions behind the crates. Zoe stands calmly, her back to the door, loading her sawed-off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing; moving back to Zoe) Zoe... are you here? She looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do the job, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hold. Hold till I'm back. He takes off -- passes Inara, the two of them holding a look for as long as they can. Then he's in the elevator and gone. Jayne moves over to Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain's right. Can't be thinking on revenge if we're gonna get through this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really think any of us are gonna get through this? He looks back at their army: A companion, a doctor, a mechanic and a more-than-usually out of it River. A beat, and he looks back at Zoe with forlorn hope:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I might...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator stops and Mal makes his way to the island of screens and machines in the center of the space. The first thing he takes in is that every broadwave port has been destroyed. The second:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MR UNIVERSE is lying dead, eyes open, half draped on his equally still lovebot. A trail of blood shows he crawled from his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal comes close. Nothing. He starts to move away again and the lovebot turns her head, her eyes focusing with an audible whir. She speaks with surprisingly realistic expressiveness, and a warped, computery version of Mr Universe's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal. Mal stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guy killed me, Mal. He killed me with a sword. How weird is that? I got... a short span here... they destroyed my equipment but I have a back-up unit... bottom of the complex, right over the generator. Hard to get to. I know they missed it. They can't stop the signal, Mal. They can never stop the signal. (BEAT) Okay this is painful. On many levels. I'm not -- A0 She turns back, powering down. Recording over. A beat, and Mal takes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inara is on her knees, unwrapping the oilcloth we saw in her shuttle. River is in the corner, clutching her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't shut them up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay... -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're all made up of rage. I can't...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as a body slams against the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just stay low. I'm right here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jayne moves past them to Zoe, takes position by her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She picked a sweet bung of a time to go helpless on us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calls out) Jayne and I take the first wave. Nobody shoots less they get past our fire. Simon moves to Kaylee, who is shaky as hell. The bangs on the door continue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I didn't plan on going out like this. I think we did right, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never planned... anything. I just wanted to keep River safe. Spent so much time on Serenity trying to find us a home I never realized I already had. She looks at him with soft surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My one true regret in all this is never being with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With me? You mean to say, as, sex?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean to say. Kaylee snaps her cartridge home with way more precision than we might expect from her, takes steady aim at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell with this. I'm gonna live. Simon looks at her a moment, then turns his attention to the door. Inara come up into frame with the contents of the oilcloth: a bow and arrow, which she pulls back with focused grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE DOOR starts to come off its hinges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A panel is kicked in from the ceiling and the Operative drops down, having clearly entered from a different location. He looks around, carrying a laser-pistol. He moves past Mr Universe and Lenore -- LOVEBOT MAL (The Operative turns) Guy killed me, Mal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal has reached it and surveys the situation. Before him is a railing, and he can look down on the generator shaft. It's miles deep, with machines rotating and grinding, and arcs of electricity ricochetting around it. On the other side is a platform, with the broadwave console sitting behind a clear plastic partition. Cables and chains run along the ceiling, around a series of ladder rungs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to get to. That's a fact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lwi12 The door is pried partially open -- enough for one Reaver to squeeze through and charge. Zoe stands up and shoots him in the head. He arcs back hard as the second comes, Zoe shoots him, calmly walking toward the door -- JAYNE Zoe... Gorramnit... But she is in a trance, and we see beneath the calm, to the bubbling magma of rage that keeps her firing, single shots, each one a kill, till five men down and she's out of ammo. The sixth comes at her swinging a blade and she blocks, the precision of military training still in her as she flips him, wresting the blade free and swinging it down out of frame, bringing it up bloody, swinging again as the door bursts open and she's rushed from behind --- But Jayne totes an automatic, sprays killing fire on the lot, moving forward himself -- J JAYNE (CONTINUING) ZOE! Get yer ass back in the line! voi12 She looks up, almost confused -- and one of Jayne's targets comes back off the ground and slices at her back with a blade, she screams as he cuts deep -- and an arrow lodges in his neck. Inara pulls up a fresh arrow, shaking only slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal is on the railing, reaching for the 'rungs' on the ceiling just above him. He can almost get them -- one wrong move and he pitches into the jaws of death... A laser shot nails him in the lower back -- he arches, legs sliding off the rail -- he falls and hits the rail with the backs of his legs, flipping painfully onto his face as he falls, mercifully, back onto the platform. The Operative comes around some equipment for a closer shot as Mal gets shakily up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in pain) Shot me in the back. I haven't... made you angry, have I? I s
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a lot of innocent people in the air being killed right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have no idea how true that is. There's no wise-ass attitude in him now. They stand, facing off at ten paces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know the secret now. The truth that burned up River Tam's brain and set you after her. And the rest of the 'verse is gonna know it too. 'Cause they need to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really believe that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You willing to die for that belief?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am. The Operative raises his gun -- but Mal is the quickdraw master, shoots the gun out of the Operative's hand and gets two hits to the chest (armored) before he makes it to cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, that ain't exactly plan A.. He drops out his cartridge and slams another in. The Operative hides behind some machinery. Tries to peek out at Mal -- and more shots send him scrambling back to cover. Mal holsters his gun and jumps for the rung above him, starts going hand over hand to the island, moving as fast as he can. The Operative sees his moment, dives for his gun -- but it's been ruined by Mal's shot. He looks over at Mal with death in his eyes. He runs at the railing, vaults off it, and grabs a chain -- it snaps and he swings, grabbing another. He reaches Mal and double kicks him from behind -- Mal flies 4 off the rung but grabs a chain -- he tries to kick at the Operative, but the guy is frikkin' Tarzan, he climbs up and pulls a lever releasing one end of Mal's chain -- Mal goes swinging, smacks into the wall six feet below the platform. He scrambles up just as the Operative swings himself toward the platform from above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jayne is still firing continuously as he drags Zoe back to the barricades. Simon moves to help -- Kaylee firing now, squinting with effort -- and pulls open the cut back of Zoe's shirt, checks the wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spine's intact -- ZOE Just gimme a bandage. Simon pulls a spraycan from his bag, sprays the wound with a foam that hardens instantly into an elastic covering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There are a few gun shots (as well as nail-balls and blades) from the Reavers. Jayne switches weapons, tossing another to Zoe and opening fire -- A0 JAYNE Oh, now you're likin' guns, huh? Cheaters! He takes a hit in the shoulder, grimaces and keeps firing. River watches, the gun limp in her hand. Kaylee grabs it and starts another round -- but she's peppered with dart-like projectiles. She screams and drops the weapon, pulling the projectiles from her -- Inara helps her up, pulls her back as Zoe shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody fall back! Fall back! Everyone stumbles or is dragged into the inner corridor. Inara hits the controls and the doors start to close, from each side and above and below. Then, when the hole is maybe four by four, they stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jayne! Grenade!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very last one... He tosses it through the hole. Zoe doesn't even flinch from the blast as she thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're gonna get in -- KAYLEE Can close it... from outside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one's coming back from that... She tries to stand, fails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much ammo do we have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got three full cartridges and my swingin' cod. That's all. Inara is by the elevator, pounding for it to come.---
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lift isn't moving...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When they come, try to plug the hole with 'em... Kaylee cries out and Simon moves to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm starting to lose some feeling here... I think there's something in them darts they throwed at me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lie still. I'm gonna give you something to counteract the -- He stands, looking around him. His bag is over by Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My bag. and SHKOWW!, the bullet takes him in the belly -- everything suddenly moving very slowly as he spins slightly, one foot lifted, a confused expression on his face -- then speeding right back up as he slams down on his back, gasping for air. River's mouth opens in a scream she doesn't make. Blood spreads from Simon's belly. Inara rushes to him, grabs cloth and puts pressure on the wound, puts Simon's hand on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep pressure here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My bag. Need... adrenaline... and a shot of calaphar for Kaylee... I can't... River...? She is by his side, takes his hand. She has a kind of serenity to her, like she understands something now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: River... I'm sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. No. The lights go out. Everyone looks about them. Jayne fires again, but all the sound has bled out save these two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate to... leave...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't. You take care of me, Simon. You've always taken care of me. She stands as the emergency lights come on, giving her face an unearthly glow as she looks down at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My turn. She's running so fast, nobody has time to react til she DIVES through the hole in the doors, then Simon SCREAMS her name, the scream following us back into the Black Room where River lands in a perfect roll, comes up in a room full of Reavers. Without a moment's hesitation she makes it to the panel, gets the doors closing. She dodges a blade, but a blow to,the back of the head shakes her. She weaves around a couple of Reavers to get to the closing doors, but at the last second her ankle is grabbed and pulled out from under her. The last thing we see is her being dragged back as they swarm over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE BLAST DOORS, as they shut with a shuddering RLUNG.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal gets up the chain to the platform. The Operative is on Mal before he gets his footing, tackles him as Mal's gun goes skittering over the edge into oblivion. There is a railing here or Mal would go over as well -- but he comes back with a couple of hammer blows, gets the Operative off him. They square off, Mal stumbling back into a tool chest, knocking over tools and computer parts. The Operative reaches behind him and pulls his sword gracefully from the holster under his jacket. Mal produces his weapon: a tiny screwdriver. He hurls a toolbox at the Operative and rushes him, gets inside sword range and tries for the neck with the screwdriver -- the Operative blocks it and works the sword point against the edge of Mal's stomach. Starts pushing slowly, despite Mal's resistance, and breaks skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mal looks at the Operative a moment -- and the sword slides all the way through Mal's belly. Mal's eyes go wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what your sin is, Malcolm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaky smile) Aw hell, I'm a fan of all seven. He headbutts the Operative viciously, then punches him so hard he staggers back, losing his grip on the sword. The Operative responds with a spin kick -- Mal holds up the screwdriver and the Operative swings his foot right into it, gasping as Mal pulls the screwdriver -- and leg it's stuck in -- back as he rockets his fist into the Operative's chin. The Operative goes down hard, dazed, as Mal grabs the sword still in his belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But right now... He pulls the sword out, grimacing. Holds it over the Operative. The smile gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: vao I'm gonna have to go with Wrath. He stabs down at his foe's face -- but the Operative rolls out of the way, kicks Mal from the ground and is up in a second, grabbing Mal's sword hand -- the sword drops -- and punching him repeatedly in his stomach wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gang is subdued -- because they are all of them injured and Simon is slipping away. Jayne looks at Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You suppose he got through? Think Mal got the word out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (almost convincingly) He got through. I know he got through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal goes down hard, spitting up blood. He sees the sword, moves -- but the Operative kicks him in the face. Picks him lod up, Mal too tired to throw a decent punch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. The Operative spins him and DIGS his bunched fingers right into the same nerve cluster that he paralyzed Doctor Mathias with. Mal goes rigid, his face a rictus of pain. The Operative goes near the railing and retrieves his sword. Mal trembles, trying to move -- but nothing happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should know there's no shame in this. You've done remarkable things. But you're fighting a war you've already lost. He lunges -- and Mal twists gracefully out of the way, grabbing the Operative's swordhand and pulling it forward -- while driving his elbow into the Operative's neck with staggering force.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Iwo Well, I'm known for that. The Operative drops the blade, mouth open, stumbling back, unable to make a sound. Mal spins him, grabbing both his arms and working his own through them in a twisted full nelson -- then bringing his arms up suddenly, the Operative's mouth going wider as we hear his arms crack. Mal drops him sitting against the railing, picks up his sword, saying:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piece a shrapnel tore up that nerve cluster my first tour. Had it moved. He squats down, looks the Operative in the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry 'bout the throat. Expect you'd wanna say your famous last
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: words now. Just one trouble. He reaches over the railing, pulls the back of the Operative's jacket through and shoves the sword through the fabric, pinning the Operative in his sitting position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't gonna kill you. He moves to the console, starts prepping it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, I'm gonna grant your greatest wish. He inserts the cylinder, turns it slightly. It hums to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna show you a world without sin. He hits "send all". The cylinder lights up and the broadcast
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: begins. Here it is projected as a two-dimensional image on the clear plastic partition, right in front of the Operative. There are images first of the city -- of bodies, on the street, in homes and offices... image after image, jus.t as we saw on the research vessel -- and in River's mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) These are some of the first sites we scouted on Miranda. There is no one living on this planet. There is no one... Mal hits the controls and a ramp extends towards the other side. He begins to cross. Never even looks back. On the Operative, trapped, watching in growing horror...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: A Reaver in EXTREME SLOW MOTION. Face full of fury, he is swinging his blade in a frenzy of hate. And a small hand smashes that face so hard that teeth fly -- the Reaver clearing frame to reveal:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . River. She is bloodied, but not killed. She's as she was in the bar -- moving faster and more efficiently than anyone can, ducking and weaving and gutting and kicking and there are piles of Reavers already, she never breaks concentration as she uses their own blades against them, throws them, does everything in her power to stay one step ahead of -- or above -- the mob. She slams backwards into a wall opposite the blast doors -- and a grappling hook punches through it, just missing her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Operative watches the end of the broadcast. We are on his face through the clear plastic, so the images projected on it blur right before him: the Reaver, Dr. Caron -- and her screaming doesn't stop til something is shoved in her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gang is still trying to patch themselves together when the elevator doors open. Mal staggers out, holding his bleeding side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's done. Report? Zoe looks at the badly wounded Simon, is about to give a report -- and the doors start to open behind her. Everyone turns to look, those who can feebly raising weapons, as the square iris of the opening blast doors widens to reveal River, standing alone. She is holding two Reaver blades, is bloody but unbowed. And the only one alive. We hold on her a moment, then the wall behind her is ripped completely away. Behind it, grappling hooks chained to a huge tractor pull the wall away as through the smoke come some fifteen Alliance soldiers, who line up, rifles trained on our gang...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop your weapons! Drop 'em now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we engage? Do we engage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mal and the others tense up. River turns slowly to face the soldiers, blades still gripped... A soldier levels his gun at her, sweaty and frantic... others still shouting... vp INT. BASEMENT, OVER THE GENERATOR - CONTINUING The Operative sits in silence, the voices coming over his com:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Targets are acquired! Do we have a kill order? Do we have an order?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE SOLDIER'S FINGER, SQUEEZING THE TRIGGER

direction.raw_text: ON: THE SOLDIER'S FINGER, SQUEEZING THE TRIGGER...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are close on a gravestone. It is rounded, looks more like a bell than a headstone. It is topped by a jar built'into the stone. The jar is weathered tin at top and bottom, but glass in the middle. Inside the glass we can see one of those slightly moving photos. It is of Mr Universe and his lovebot, and the name Mr Universe is carved roughly in the stone beneath. The camera moves to the right and we see another such stone,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: this one bearing the image and inscription: Shepherd Derrial Book. The third is Hoban Washburne. Wash. The camera continues moving right, but the next stone houses a small home-made rocket with pieces of paper taped to it instead of a picture-jar. And fixing another slip of paper to it is River. She moves away from the stone as Mal does likewise. They're flanked by the crew: Jayne, Inara (to whom Mal moves), Simon, who stands holding River before him and hand in hand with Kaylee. He has a crutch supporting his other side. There is a moment, then they all move aside, saying nothing. Between them walks Zoe, in a simple white funeral gown, holding a burning taper. She stands at the stones a moment, then holds the taper to the rocket fuse. Stands back with the others. The rocket shoots up into the darkening sky. They all watch its sputtering tail a moment, then it it explodes in a series of fireworks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON the group, as the fireworks go off over their heads. We are close on another explosion when it becomes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: A BLOWTORCH spitting sparks. Widen to see:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoe is harnessed to the nose of the ship, welding on a replacement for the very window the harpoon that impaled Wash came through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are close on River as she works inside a crawlspace just above the engine room, replacing wires. Some of them run to a computer screen that she checks and adjusts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal and Jayne hold onto the cannon as a crane is lifting it off the top of the ship. Close on Mal as he watches it go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: t f o And here we see the whole ship for the first time, harnessed by the wings above the ground so she can be worked on all over. The cannon is being hoisted away from her as a crew of repairmen wheel new landing gear under her belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kaylee, deeply greasy, tweaks a part on the engine and crosses to the back where Simon, shirtless and not entirely ungreasy himself, is wrenching a bolt into place above his head. A moment looking at him and she can't help herself - she slides her arms around his chest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On a scaffold, Inara repaints the name on the nose with elegant precision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kaylee and Simon are just making out like fiends, work completely forgotten. With nothing resembling elegant precision, they sink out of frame to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A beat, and River's head appears from the crawlspace above, looking down at them with detached curiosity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's raining as Mal is hauling in the last of the repair equipment. The camera moves around him, skirting the ground of the junkyard, till it lands on a figure in foreground, standing watching him from some twenty feet away. Mal stops, doesn't turn. Hand near his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're here to tell me we ain't finished... then we will be real quick. The Operative stands just under the canopy of the nose of the ship, framed by the rain behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what an uproar you've caused? Protests, riots -- cries for a recall of the entire Parliament.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've seen the broadwaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Verse wakes up a spell. Won't be long 'fore she rolls right over and falls back asleep. Taint my worry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't guarantee they won't come after you. The Parliament. They have a hundred men like me and they are not forgiving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That don't bode especially well for you... giving the order to let us go, patching up our hurt...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told them the Tams were no longer a threat -- damage done. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) They might listen, but... I think they know I'm no longer their man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They take you down, I don't expect to grieve overmuch. Like to kill you myself, I see you again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't. There is... (small, grim smile) .nothing left to see. Mal looks at him a moment, then picks up his gear to head inside. The Operative starts away into the rain, then stops to look up at the nose of the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : the newly painted Serenity, standing tall in the rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Serenity". You lost everything in that battle. Everything you had, everything you were... how did you go on? Mal hits the button to close the inner doors, steps inside as they slide together. Glances at the Operative, unimpressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still standing there when the engine starts, you never will figure it out. The Operative watches the door shut. A moment, and he goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal stows the gear as Zoe approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to himself) What a whiner...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, we have a green light. Inspection's pos and we're clear for upthrust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think she'll hold together?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's tore up plenty. But she'll fly true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat between them before:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make sure everything's secure. Could be bumpy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Always is. She takes off and Mal heads up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal comes in and runs into Inara. Jayne passes through as they talk, heading down into his bunk. Pays them no mind. Neither do Simon and Kaylee, in the dining room stowing supplies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're taking her out. Should be about a day's ride to get you back to your girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (moving past her) You ready to get off this heap and back to a civilized life?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: uh... (he stops) I don't know. He looks at her, a smile in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good answer. He turns and heads into the bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal eases himself into his seat. Takes a moment to adjust one of Wash's dashboard dinosaurs, then looks to his left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna ride shotgun, help me fly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: River is in the copilot's seat, looking intently at the screens and buttons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think you can work out how to get her in the -- She is flipping switches without even looking, as the ship hums to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her engines fire up and tilt. She lifts gently off the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mal looks slightly, only slightly nonplussed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, clearly some aptitude for the... but it ain't all buttons
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and charts, . You know what the first rule of flying is? Well, I suppose you do, since you already know what I'm about to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. But I like to hear you say it. He looks out at the rain on his windows, at his screens, taking her up as he says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love. You can learn all the math in the 'verse, but you take a boat in the air you don't love, she'll shake you off just as sure as the turning of worlds. Love keeps her in the air when she oughta fall down, tells you she's hurting 'fore she keens. Makes her a home. River also looks out at the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Storm's getting worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll pass through it soon enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As we shoot up with her through sheeting rain, towards the top of the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are looking down on the stormclouds as Serenity bursts out of them, comes at us, flared by the sun behind the planet as she passes us, her Firefly effect lighting up, about to shoot off into the heavens -- There is a spark and a piece of paneling pops off, whips at camera, blacking out the frame.
direction.name: direction
